name: Divine Damage Paladin Arcane Archer (Paladin 16 / Wizard 1 / Arcane Archer 23)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This is a devlishly simple idea I came up with:

Paladin for divine favor casts (including extended divine favor), divine might (boosted by special paladin charisma spell buffs)
Pump Cha up high to do lots of divine damage, up to 16 damage / hit.
Arcane archer for crazy AB boosts
Wizard 1 for scribe scroll, resist elements, can use many magical scrolls, wands, sequencers etc, spellcraft dump for further saves against spells (nice, not that it was needed, but lets use it...)
Elf for keen senses which works well with spot/listen and a reasonable wisdom score.

Dropped the AB down to 47. Maybe cleric would be stronger, but at least paladin being a full BAB class doesn't have to worry about divine power getting dispeled or morded. 

Grizzled_Dwarflord has a half elf Moon Knight of Corellon, essentially pure Cha Paladin / Sorc / AA. 
Ariel Thomas has another pure Cha build Charismatic Sniper Paladin 15/Wiz 2 / AA 23. 

Anyway I've put this up for your enjoyment and review.

Included suggestions from GDL, with thanks!

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
For those suggesting Craft Wand, I would not take Craft Wand in a build like this.  Rather, I would be more likely to take Extra Turning so you can increase your opportunities for actual Divine Damage delivery upon thine enemy.  Craft Wand is of limited utility in a Paladin.  

My other suggestion would be to strive for more balance, so instead of soaking up another feat for Extend Spell -- for a very limited use of Divine Favor (you only get one 1 base spell slot for 2nd, level, and then a bonus slot for 20 Wisdom) -- I would take Divine Shield for instant AC buff.  The inherent problem with any Paladin AA, as you have now discovered, is they are even more feat intensive than a Weapon Master.  There are so many feats that you must have, then ones that you need, and then the ones that you want:  PBS, WF, Power Attack, Divine Might, Rapid Shot, Called Shot.  Then you want BF, and DS, and Extra Turning, and Extend and on and on....

Taking an Epic Toughness as your AA bonus feat is a bit of a tragedy.  That makes me reconsider the entire point of grabbing Zen Archery with a base final Wisdom of 20.  Minoring in Dex (with you major still in Charisma) is probably the better way to go, and then just completely selling out on Charisma and your capacity to end all life with Divine Arrows.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:
Jan 29, 2020
I don't know if you have had a look at my old Holy Elven Archer build....
Orion, 
I posted this link because I wanted to illustrate an important feature of the AA class. The Enchant Arrow feat gives +1 AB and +1 damage every second level. That makes it possible to make a viable AA build even with no (or almost no) investments in dexterity (or wisdom for Zen). That opens up for builds with focus on full strength for dev crit and high mighty damage or full charisma for DM, DS and other divine feats. To make such builds work you must take enough AA levels for the AB to become high enough.
Taking many AA levels also gives epic bonus feats for EWF, EP and Great dexterity. This let you take more Great charisma (or Great strength for strength builds) on general feats.
The difference between a Paladin 15/wizard 1/ AA 24 and Paladin 9/ wizard 1/AA 30 illustrates this point.
Paladin 15 grants +5 AB and damage on Divine favor. Paladin 9 only gives a +3 bonus. So adding 6 levels of Paladin grants a +2 bonus for a limited number of times per day. 6 levels of AA on the other hand add +3 AB and damage to every arrow all day long. And the AB bonus from Enchant arrow does not even count towards the +20 AB bonus cap.
AA 30 also grants 5 epic bonus feats instead of the 3 you get from AA 24.
Paladin 15 (or 16 in your build) gives a better spell book than 8 or 9 levels do. But you have to invest in wisdom for it to work. And the Paladin spell book is better for a melee character.
Don't get me wrong. Paladin 16 makes for a good build. I just wanted to show what can happen when you try to min/max with a focus on divine damage.
